p: The influenza A virus genome encodes 10 core proteins and a variable number of accessory proteins. The genome is coated in viral nucleoprotein (NP) and adopts a twisted pan handle conformation with trimeric polymerase (PA, PB1 and PB2) attached, forming a ribonucleoprotein (RNP) complex. The RNP is encircled by the M1 matrix protein which is surrounded by a host-derived lipid bilayer envelope in which the HA and NA as well as the M2 matrix protein are embedded [ 2]. Additionally, the core non-structural protein (NS) encodes an mRNA transcript that is alternatively spliced to express two proteins involved in innate immune modulation and export of RNPs from the nucleus [ 3].
